column4: is there any particular reason X doesn't start on the 7.04 livecd?
does it in safe graphics mode?
do you have a new ati card?
hmm... good question, and yes
yes, as in i do have an ati x1600, and good question to whether safe mode graphics work or not
yeah there's lots of issues with new ati cards
i've noticed... would've gotten an nvidia if i'd realized the drivers suck so much
if you install into safe graphics mode, then enable the restricted driver, you may be OK
i also have fail after installing xorg-driver-fglrx (or however it happens to be spelled)
and subsequently editing /etc/X11/xorg.conf
did you try using the restricted manager?
i assume that's something or other in safe graphics mode, yes?
it's ubuntu's installer for fglrx
system>adminstration>restricted manager
let me restart and see if i can get in with safe graphics mode, i'll probably be back (and thanks for helping)
safe graphics mode doesn't let me get into X
then you'd have to use the alternate cd
i tried, but the alternate CD is just as broken as the livecd
can you believe that card is so crappy that it doesn't support vesa?
it supports it under every other release of ubuntu i've ever used
I don't know then
